content: Do cows pollute as much as the US?
Are silent gas leaks a problem for the climate?
How did Hemingway like his burger?

💦 ff.19.1 Polluting flatulence
Cows emit more methane than the United States, equal to the pollution from global transportation. OurWorldInData reveals that plant-based foods pollute 10 times less than animal products, with hazelnuts being a positive exception.

🍔 ff.19.2 Hemingway's favorite burger
Hemingway enjoyed a simple burger: ground beef, onions, capers, and Indian relish, cooked to a crisp on the outside but soft and juicy in the middle, served on a bun with no extra toppings.

♨️ ff.19.3 Killer stoves
Gas stoves emit methane even when turned off, releasing emissions equivalent to the use of 0.5 million cars in the U.S., accounting for 0.2% of their emissions.

🐖 ff.19.4 Cool sustainable choices
La Vie's packaging redesign uses pink and green to attract consumers, showing that clever design can improve product sustainability and appeal.

💉 ff.19.5 3D printed meat
Redefine Meat uses 3D printing technology to produce vegan burgers that replicate the muscle fibers of real meat, making plant-based options taste and feel closer to animal meat.
Can we transplant an animal heart into a human?
Will we translate pig grunts?
What can we learn from the creator of 'Amazon for pets'?

🐖 ff.25.1 Pig heart transplants
The genetic modification of pigs enabled the first successful heart transplant with no rejection, although infections from animals still pose challenges.

🫀 ff.25.2 The organ transplant dilemma
In the U.S., 60,000 people are on the waiting list for transplants, but only 65% are fulfilled. Kidneys are the most needed (83%).

🙊 ff.25.3 Translating pig language
AI has reached 90% accuracy in correlating pig grunts with emotional states, based on stress and well-being data from farm environments.

📦 ff.25.4 Amazon for pets: a bubble?
Ryan Cohen, founder of Chewy and now executive at GameStop, capitalized on the pandemic pet trend, but Chewy's value dropped 50% in 2022, mirroring the tech industry's post-pandemic struggles.

cards.title: 👚 Fast fashion, Vinted, and robotic fashion

content: What is the impact of fashion on the climate?
Will Vinted help the planet?
How to produce a robotic garment (starting from an NFT)?

🏭 ff.39.1 The impact of fast fashion on the climate
Textiles contribute 5-10% of global emissions. Every year, 500,000 tons of clothes end up in the ocean, creating 35% of the world's microplastics.

🔄 ff.39.2 Vinted: a solution?
In 2021, online second-hand sales in the U.S. accounted for nearly half of the sales of Inditex (Zara), showing rapid growth for marketplaces like Vinted.

⚗️ ff.39.3 A mix of science, tech, and fashion
Artists and brands use AI like DALL-E to design new garments. Bella Hadid recently modeled a spray-on dress that solidifies into wearable fabric, pushing the boundaries of tech in fashion.

Does biking pollute more than a car (if we only eat asparagus)?
The cost (in CO2-eq) of a car accident

🔟 ff.58.1 The cost of a human life
According to Mike Berners-Lee, the average person emits 10 tons of CO2 annually. A human life 'costs' 150 tons of CO2, roughly 5% of the UK's GDP per capita.

🕹️ ff.58.2 Emissions Minecraft
Travel emissions vary: 53 kg CO2eq for cycling with bananas, 1100 kg CO2eq for flying from New York to Niagara Falls.

💲 ff.58.4 Spending a dollar
On average, spending one dollar generates 0.1-1 kg of CO2. Living frugally and investing in renewables can significantly reduce personal environmental impact.

cards.title: 🌍 COP26 and the race to zero

content: COP26, renewable energy, micro-mobility
A beautiful art project giving COP26 a fresh visual identity.
Bill Gates.

📉 ff.1.2 From 51 billion to zero
Bill Gates highlights that we need to reduce the 51 billion tons of CO2-equivalent emissions produced annually to zero to prevent climate disaster.

🛴 ff.1.3 Electric scooters will save us?
80% of U.S. trips are shorter than 16 km. Micro-mobility infrastructure, like e-scooters and e-bikes, can significantly reduce emissions from short-distance travel.

🏭 ff.1.4 Capturing CO2 is essential
Carbon capture, particularly in cement and steel sectors, is vital for reducing global emissions. Currently, the technology costs $100 per ton of CO2 captured.
